basics.name: Roma Amor Malasarte
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

work.summary: Manage and Support the technology infrastructure
highlights: Maintain the data center of UH, network patching and documentation, and perform data security measures.

work.summary: Plan program events and manage administrative tasks
highlights: Plan logistics for every program scheduled for the semester. (e.g. silent disco, s'mores night, Plan your semester, etc.)
Handling email communcations and managing the budget.
Plan semester retreats for our general assembly.

summary: Clean up around the Kalo patches, remove any morning glory and leaves.
Learn about the founder and origin of the Loʻi and how fresh water came available.
In collaboration with Sierra Club, I extracted Invasive species, Koa Haole, from the Wawamalu Beach Park in order to restore the beach to its natural/ native state.

volunteer.organization: Supporting Women in Tech and Computing Hawaii
summary: In collaborative efforts with the Girl Scouts of Hawaii, I taught them fun STEM activities such as constructing LED photo frames and brush bots.

awards.title: Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who exhibit high school academic performance and cumulative GPA.

awards.title: Pace Leader Scholarship
awards.summary: I participate in facilitating the Kalo Grants Program, a grant that provides small amounts of funding to students with business ideas, a new program at Pace.
